stories.fact: President Trump stated he will seek to require voter ID for midterm elections regardless of Congress.
A man was shot dead after attacking police near the Arc de Triomphe in Paris.
President Trump stated the U.S. will send a second aircraft carrier to the Middle East.
President Emmanuel Macron stated at the Munich conference that Europe must become a geopolitical power in its own right.
Friedrich Merz, Chancellor of Germany, called on the U.S. and Europe to repair and revive trans-Atlantic trust.
stories.source: The Globe and Mail - 8.4* | PBS NewsHour - 9.1*

stories.fact: Russia and Ukraine are scheduled to hold talks in Geneva next week with U.S. involvement. Talks on Iran are also scheduled for Tuesday in Geneva
stories.source: The Straits Times - 7.6* | The Globe and Mail - 8.6* (1/1) | Reuters - 9.8* (2/2)

stories.fact: Federal authorities initiated a perjury investigation into Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers' testimony regarding a shooting involving a Venezuelan national.
stories.source: Associated Press - 9.6* | The Globe and Mail - 8.7* (2/2)

stories.fact: Secretary of State Marco Rubio stated that the United States and Europe 'belong together' despite tensions.
At least 30 people killed in north-west Nigerian villages according to residents.
The U.S. military reported conducting airstrikes against Islamic State targets in Syria.
French prosecutors announce special team to analyze Epstein files.
